questions.text: A 33-year-old man was taken to the emergency room by the police after neighbors complained about his behavior. His family informed the doctor that he had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder and was recently started on lithium. While in the emergency room, he became combative and punched a nurse in the mouth. What is the next step in the management of this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Start Olanzapine The patient is exhibiting mania and antipsychotics are considered first-line treatment for bipolar patients, especially if acutely and severely manic.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A – Verifying the lithium level is not needed given that his symptoms are acute and that he apparently has been noncompliant with medications, obtaining a lithium level is not correct. Option C – Lithium and valproic acid are not indicated to be co-administered. Option D – Admitting an agitated patient to the psychiatric unit is not as important as administering adequate treatment.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male is brought by his father with complaints that he doesn’t like to mingle much with people, hasn’t had many friends, doesn’t enjoy relationships and family gatherings, shows emotional coldness in most situations, and isn’t interested in any activities or knowing people. Diagnosis of Schizoid personality disorder is made. The true statements about the treatment of this condition are all except-

options.label: A
options.text: Pharmacotherapy with small doses of antipsychotics, antidepressants, and psychostimulants

options.label: B
options.text: Serotonergic agents make patients less sensitive to rejection.

options.label: C
options.text: Mood stabilizers have a great effect.

options.label: D
options.text: Benzodiazepines may help diminish interpersonal anxiety.

questions.correct_answer: C. Mood stabilizers have a great effect.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mood stabilizers have a great effect. The given clinical scenario of Schizoid personality disorder.

Highyeild:

The treatment measures are as follows – Psychotherapy . Pharmacotherapy with small doses of antipsychotics, antidepressants, and psychostimulants has benefitted some patients. Serotonergic agents may make patients less sensitive to rejection. Benzodiazepines may help diminish interpersonal anxiety. There is no definitive evidence of mood stabilizers' effect in treating Schizoid personality disorder. Hence, Option C is false.

Random:

Explanation For Other Options:- Option A, B and D- Are correct statements, therefore not the answer.
